description.narrative: This programme will support a substantial reduction in plastic waste generation through impact across five key areas (tbc during programme design); a) Research & Evidence, b) Design & Innovation, c) Catalytic Funding, d) Enabling environments, e) Building Capacity. It will contribute to results including a reduction in the amount of plastic waste entering the oceans and a decrease in negative environmental impacts associated with poor plastic waste management, notably flood risk from the blockage of drainage systems and ambient air pollution due to burning of waste. The threat posed by plastics waste in low and middle income countries is also an opportunity to create, and improve the quality of, jobs (particular in the informal sector), promote economic activity and reduce import dependency through improved collection and recycling. This programme will take a whole systems approach and incorporate actors from industry, civil society, academia as well as other government partners.
